publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1096 Dennis Canavan: SBG and Transport Operatives Pension Schemes-That the Parliament notes that both the Scottish Bus Group pensions scheme and the Transport Operatives pension scheme have still to be wound up some seven years after privatisation; further notes that the schemes have a surplus of around £129 million and that some 8,000 pensioners and 4,000 deferred pensioners are awaiting payment from this surplus, and requests the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to secure the maximum possible benefit for the pensioners and deferred pensioners from that surplus. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson*

S1M-1096# Dennis Canavan: SBG and Transport Operatives Pension Schemes-That the Parliament notes that both the Scottish Bus Group pensions scheme and the Transport Operatives pension scheme have still to be wound up some seven years after privatisation; further notes that the schemes have a surplus of around £129 million and that some 8,000 pensioners and 4,000 deferred pensioners are awaiting payment from this surplus, and requests the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to secure the maximum possible benefit for the pensioners and deferred pensioners from that surplus. S1M-1096# Dennis Canavan: SBG and Transport Operatives Pension Schemes—That the Parliament notes that both the Scottish Bus Group pensions scheme and the Transport Operatives pension scheme have still to be wound up some seven years after privatisation; further notes that the schemes have a surplus of around £129 million and that some 8,000 pensioners and 4,000 deferred pensioners are awaiting payment from this surplus, and requests the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to secure the maximum possible benefit for the pensioners and deferred pensioners from that surplus. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson, Cathie Craigie, Fergus Ewing, Ms Sandra White, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Maureen Macmillan, Karen Whitefield, Mr Michael McMahon, Dr Richard Simpson, Des McNulty, Cathy Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Johann Lamont, Hugh Henry, Mr Andy Kerr, Mr Duncan McNeil, Tommy Sheridan, Phil Gallie, Mr John Swinney, Alex Neil, Ms Margo MacDonald, George Lyon, Euan Robson, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Allan Wilson, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Brian Adam, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Linda Fabiani, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ian Jenkins, Mr Murray Tosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David McLetchie, Irene Oldfather, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Cathy Peattie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Elaine Smith, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Keith Harding, Alasdair Morgan, Fiona McLeod, John Scott, Fiona Hyslop, Trish Godman, Mr Adam Ingram, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston, Mr Brian Monteith, Helen Eadie, Mr John Munro, Mr Lloyd Quinan, David Mundell, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr John McAllion, Ben Wallace, Gordon Jackson, Margaret Smith, Kate MacLean, Scott Barrie, Mr David Davidson, Paul Martin, John Young, Pauline McNeill, Marilyn Livingstone, Ms Margaret Curran, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Mike Rumbles, Mr Gil Paterson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bill Aitken*, Janis Hughes*, Elaine Thomson*, Tavish Scott*, Alex Johnstone*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Colin Campbell*

S1M-1096# Dennis Canavan: SBG and Transport Operatives Pension Schemes—That the Parliament notes that both the Scottish Bus Group pensions scheme and the Transport Operatives pension scheme have still to be wound up some seven years after privatisation; further notes that the schemes have a surplus of around £129 million and that some 8,000 pensioners and 4,000 deferred pensioners are awaiting payment from this surplus, and calls for urgent action to be taken in order to secure the maximum possible benefit for the pensioners and deferred pensioners from that surplus. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson, Cathie Craigie, Fergus Ewing, Ms Sandra White, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Maureen Macmillan, Karen Whitefield, Mr Michael McMahon, Dr Richard Simpson, Des McNulty, Cathy Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Johann Lamont, Hugh Henry, Mr Andy Kerr, Mr Duncan McNeil, Tommy Sheridan, Phil Gallie, Mr John Swinney, Alex Neil, Ms Margo MacDonald, George Lyon, Euan Robson, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Allan Wilson, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Brian Adam, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Linda Fabiani, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ian Jenkins, Mr Murray Tosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David McLetchie, Irene Oldfather, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Cathy Peattie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Elaine Smith, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Keith Harding, Alasdair Morgan, Fiona McLeod, John Scott, Fiona Hyslop, Trish Godman, Mr Adam Ingram, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston, Mr Brian Monteith, Helen Eadie, Mr John Munro, Mr Lloyd Quinan, David Mundell, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr John McAllion, Ben Wallace, Gordon Jackson, Margaret Smith, Kate MacLean, Scott Barrie, Mr David Davidson, Paul Martin, John Young, Pauline McNeill, Marilyn Livingstone, Ms Margaret Curran, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Mike Rumbles, Mr Gil Paterson, Roseanna Cunningham, Bill Aitken, Janis Hughes, Elaine Thomson, Tavish Scott, Alex Johnstone, Malcolm Chisholm, Colin Campbell, Richard Lochhead*
